title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Aluminum prices fell to 3,095.75 USD/T on February 13, 2026, down 0.05% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have dropped 2.85%, though they remain 17.31% higher than a year ago. UK aluminum futures fell to $3,050 per tonne amid reports of potential US tariff reductions on the metal.

title: Aluminum price drops as Trump moves to narrow levies on metal products
summary: Aluminum prices fell as much as 2.7% on the London Metal Exchange following reports that President Trump plans to roll back some levies on aluminum and steel products. The tariffs, doubled to 50% last year, have disrupted markets and raised costs for manufacturers. Aluminum settled 0.7% lower at $3,077.50 a ton on the LME.

title: Aluminum Falls on Likely US Tariff Slash
summary: Aluminum futures in the UK fell to $3,050 per tonne, continuing the pullback from a three-year high. The decline follows reports of a likely US tariff reduction on aluminum imports.

title: February 14: Aluminum Prices Strong While Downstream Orders Remain Weak; Aluminum Billet Processing Fees in Three Regions Remain Flat Compared to Yesterday - Daily Review of Spot Aluminum Billets
summary: Aluminum prices remained strong on February 14 despite weak downstream orders. Aluminum billet processing fees in three regions stayed flat compared to the previous day.

title: Trump signals rollback on 50% steel and aluminum tariffs – what it means for solar
summary: The Trump administration is preparing to scale back up to 50% tariffs on imported steel and aluminum to address an affordability crisis. This could significantly lower costs for the US solar industry, where aluminum frames now represent 14% of solar panel manufacturing costs. The rollback may ease Balance of System costs for utility-scale and residential solar projects.

title: US aluminium prices break away as tariffs collide with global supply strain
summary: US aluminum prices have surged past USD 5,000 per tonne due to tariffs, falling imports, shrinking stocks, and Europe's supply disruptions. This decoupling highlights tightening global supply dynamics amid ongoing trade tensions.

title: Metals retreat on reports Trump may soften aluminium tariffs
summary: Metals prices retreated on the London Metal Exchange after reports that Trump may soften aluminum tariffs. The benchmark three-month aluminum contract slipped more than 2.5% to $2,965.75 a tonne.

title: Aluminum price rises as looming smelter closure adds to supply strains
summary: South32 Ltd. is proceeding with plans to mothball its Mozal smelter in Mozambique next month, a major supplier to the European market. The closure adds to growing supply constraints as Chinese smelters near government-imposed production capacity caps and 50% US tariffs have caused imports to slump, with aluminum prices rallying 17% last year and 5.5% so far in 2026.

title: Trump signals rollback on 50% steel and aluminum tariffs: What it means for solar
summary: The Trump administration is reportedly preparing to scale back up to 50% tariffs on imported steel and aluminum to address affordability concerns. The shift toward 'targeted' metal duties could significantly impact the solar supply chain, where aluminum frames have become the costliest component in panel production at 14% of manufacturing costs.

title: Bessent discusses possible narrowing of steel, aluminum tariffs
summary: Treasury Secretary Bessent commented on reports of potential tariff rollbacks, stating that any changes would likely involve clarification on incidental objects rather than broad scaling back. The Trump administration has imposed 50% tariffs on steel and aluminum imports, with discussions ongoing about possible modifications.

title: US government launches new aluminum recycling technology
summary: The US Department of Energy's Pacific Northwest National Laboratory has patented the Shear Assisted Processing and Extrusion Process (ShAPE), which transforms 100% of aluminum scrap into construction-ready extrusions. This technology reduces energy use by pulverizing impurities using heat from scrap cutting, eliminating the need to mix with virgin material. It promises significant decarbonization in construction by enabling deeper use of scrap without performance loss.

title: Steel Slides to 1-Month Low
summary: Steel rebar futures fell to around CNY 3,070 per ton, hitting a one-month low as Chinese steel mills trimmed production ahead of the Lunar New Year holiday. Several blast furnaces and electric-arc furnaces paused operations for planned maintenance, weighing on near-term demand.

title: HRC Steel Hits 23-month High
summary: HRC Steel increased to 970.00 USD/T, the highest since January 2024. Over the past 4 weeks, Hot-Rolled Coil Steel gained 3.3%, and in the last 12 months, it increased 31.83%.

title: Bessent discusses possible narrowing of steel, aluminum tariffs
summary: U.S. Treasury Secretary Bessent discussed the Trump administration's potential plan to scale back 50 percent tariffs on steel and aluminum imports to address rising affordability issues. Officials believe the tariffs are hurting consumers by raising prices for goods including pie tins and food-and-drink cans.

title: Trump plans to roll back some tariffs on steel, aluminium goods
summary: U.S. President Donald Trump plans to scale back some tariffs on steel and aluminum goods, according to Financial Times reporting. The move comes as Commerce Department and trade officials believe the tariffs are hurting consumers, with shares of major steelmakers declining following the announcement.

title: US raw steel production is up 1.4 percent - week 6, 2026
summary: US domestic raw steel production for the week ending February 7, 2026, reached 1.783 million net tons, up 1.4% from the previous week and 4.9% from the same week in 2025. Capacity utilization was 77.1%. Adjusted year-to-date production through February 7 was 9.557 million net tons at 76.2% utilization, a 3.7% increase year-over-year.

title: Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Steel prices rose to 3,056 CNY/T on February 13, 2026, up 0.53% from the previous day, amid Chinese steel mills curtailing operations ahead of Lunar New Year holidays. Rebar futures fell near CNY 3,050 per ton due to blast furnace and electric-arc furnace pauses for maintenance and pollution curbs in Hebei. Prices are down 2.80% over the past month and 4.68% year-over-year.

title: Construction steel prices: Yining (Feb 13, 2026 19:05)
summary: Mysteel reports construction steel prices in Yining, China, collected on February 13, 2026, including round bar and other products with 13% VAT. Similar daily price updates were issued for other regions like Kuitun, Kumul, Urumchi, and Zhuhai on February 14. These reflect ongoing market monitoring amid rangebound expectations for February.

title: Bessent discusses possible narrowing of steel, aluminum tariffs
summary: US Treasury Secretary Bessent discussed potential narrowing of 50% tariffs on steel and aluminum imports and derivatives like appliances in a CNBC interview. The Trump administration imposed these tariffs, but changes may clarify incidental items ahead of midterm elections. He noted it would be the president's decision after consulting the US Trade Rep.

title: Fujitsu launches demonstration experiment into green steel value flow utilizing blockchain technology to accelerate decarbonization in the steel industry
summary: Fujitsu has commenced a demonstration experiment on green steel value flow in the steel industry, selected by Japan's METI, running from December 2025 to February 2026. The project leverages blockchain and data platforms to securely distribute environmental value data, ensuring transaction confidentiality and preventing duplication across supply chains. It aims to accelerate decarbonization in manufacturing and establish sustainable supply chains.

title: Innovative Steel Method May Cut U.S. Import Dependence
summary: Hertha Metals is scaling up a new steel production system using natural gas or hydrogen to reduce iron ore and electricity to melt it in a single-step continuous electric arc furnace. This process eliminates coking and sintering, uses 30% less energy, cuts costs by 25%, and reduces emissions compared to traditional methods. The company operates a pilot plant and plans a 10,000-ton plant by end of 2027.

title: Copper - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Copper rose to 5.81 USD/Lbs on February 13, 2026, up 0.43% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have fallen 4.05%, but remain 25.63% higher than a year ago. The price later showed a 2.03% decrease to 5.8445 USD/Lbs, with futures steadying above $5.95 per pound ahead of China's Lunar New Year.

title: Copper scrap prices: Baoding (Feb 13, 2026 17:40)
summary: Mysteel reports copper scrap prices in Baoding, China, including grades like brass (Cu:98%), low-voltage cable (Cu≥99.5%), and others with low, high, and mid prices in Yuan/tonne including 13% VAT. Prices were updated as of February 13, 2026, 17:40, reflecting regional market activity. Similar updates available for other Chinese cities like Foshan and Shanghai on February 14.

title: What happened to gold, silver, platinum and copper today? Why are precious metal prices crashing sharply today?
summary: Copper slid 2.78% to $5.80 per pound on February 12, 2026, amid a broader plunge in metal prices including gold, silver, and platinum. The drop reflects technical pressure, macro uncertainty, slowing Chinese manufacturing signals, and reactions to strong US data. Traders eye upcoming CPI data for potential volatility.

title: Copper price: Strains deepen as global smelting activity hits decade low
summary: Copper for March delivery fell over 3% to $5.78 a pound, trading 12% below recent highs, amid deepening strains from record-low global smelting activity in January per satellite data. China showed lower inactivity at 7.5%, but mine disruptions have tightened concentrate supply, pushing spot TCRCs deeply negative. Benchmark agreements hit record lows.

title: Copper Prices Drop Before China Break: February 2026 Analysis
summary: Copper prices consolidated around $5.90 per pound in New York markets during February 2026, dropping ahead of China's holiday break. The analysis highlights volatility driven by market holidays and economic forces. Prices reflect ongoing dynamic pressures in the copper market.

title: AWS to Source Low Carbon Nuton Copper from Rio Tinto for U.S. Data Center Infrastructure
summary: Amazon Web Services (AWS) will source low-carbon copper from Rio Tinto's Nuton technology for its U.S. data centers. Nuton uses microorganisms to extract copper from sulphide ores, reducing water and emissions intensity while producing pure copper cathode at the mine site. The collaboration leverages AWS's cloud analytics to optimize the process, supporting sustainability in copper production for growing data center demands.

title: Rio Tinto and Amazon Web Services collaborate to bring low-carbon Nuton copper to U.S. data centres
summary: Rio Tinto and AWS have a two-year agreement where AWS will incorporate the first Nuton-produced copper into U.S. data center components. Nuton technology enables lower-carbon copper extraction using bioleaching, shortening the production chain and minimizing environmental impact. This partnership combines mining innovation with cloud computing to scale sustainable copper supply.

title: Henkel showcases new material innovations, sustainability concept at LOPEC 2026
summary: Henkel introduces silver plated-copper (SPC) ink technology at LOPEC 2026 to address high silver prices and promote sustainability in printed electronics. The inks reduce costs and volatility while maintaining performance, incorporating recycled silver for eco-friendly production. Additional innovations include high-conductivity inks and self-regulating PTC inks for applications in wearables, healthcare, and thermal management.

title: Nickel Futures Prices Inched Lower in February
summary: Nickel prices declined in February amid macroeconomic headwinds including higher-than-expected CPI (6.4%) and PPI (6%) data, along with hawkish Federal Reserve commentary raising interest rate concerns. The LME announced on February 23 that Asian nickel trading would resume on March 20, which also contributed to price declines.

title: Nickel fell to 16,995 USD/T on February 13, 2026
summary: Nickel prices fell 1.48% to $16,995 per tonne on February 13, declining 9.53% over the past month despite remaining 9.96% higher than a year ago.[1] Nickel futures had surged to $17,900 per tonne earlier in February following Indonesia's announcement of production quota cuts to 270 million tonnes for 2026.

title: World's Biggest Nickel Mine in Indonesia Told to Slash Output
summary: PT Weda Bay Nickel, the world's largest nickel mine, has been notified of a drastic production quota cut to 12 million tons in 2026, down from 42 million tons in 2025. The Indonesian government is implementing these cuts to boost global prices of its largest export commodity. Nickel prices climbed following the announcement, as the metal is essential for both stainless steel and electric-vehicle batteries.

title: Philippine nickel sales to Indonesia to jump after Jakarta curbs
summary: Philippine nickel ore shipments to Indonesia could double to 30 million tons in 2026 following Indonesia's production cuts. Philippine miners see this as an opportunity to fill the supply gap created by Indonesia's domestic output reduction, though expansion may be limited by aging mines and slow approval processes.

title: Nickel Futures Rise from 1-Month Low
summary: Nickel futures rebounded to around $17,400 per tonne from a one-month low, driven by supply concerns linked to Indonesia's confirmed mining permit cuts to 260 million wet tons in 2026. The reduction signals tighter availability of nickel feedstock for stainless steel and battery production, with enforcement against illegal mining adding to supply uncertainty.

title: Indonesia's Weda Bay Nickel facing quota cut by 70%, causing nickel prices to surge
summary: The Indonesian government has drastically cut the production quota for PT Weda Bay Nickel to 12 million tons, representing a 70% reduction from previous levels. This action is causing nickel prices to surge as markets respond to the tightening supply outlook.

title: The Nickel Report
summary: The report covers regulatory updates from PHMSA regarding hazardous materials shipping standards, including new regulations for sodium ion batteries aligned with lithium ion battery standards. It also discusses companies reconsidering sustainability targets due to economic pressures and challenges in meeting interim decarbonization goals.

title: TRADE REVIEW: Asian nickel market faces Q1 pressure as oversupply outweighs output cuts
summary: The Asian nickel market is expected to face pressure in Q1 2026 due to oversupply despite Indonesia's production control efforts. Market participants note a shift away from nickel-manganese-cobalt batteries toward lithium-iron-phosphate batteries, with automakers reducing high-nickel battery usage due to cost considerations.

title: Nickel Industries showcases sustainability in quarterly update
summary: Nickel Industries reported achieving zero lost-time injuries over 12 months with 17.7 million safe man-hours and a low injury frequency rate of 0.68. The company also completed a strategic investment acquiring a 10 percent stake in Excelsior Nickel Cobalt and received national recognition for sustainability leadership from the Indonesia Leadership Award 2025 and CNBC Indonesia.

title: Tenaris to invest in hydrogen steelmaking in Italy
summary: Tubemaker Tenaris has signed an agreement with Italian energy suppliers Edison and Snam for a project using hydrogen in steelmaking at its Dalmine seamless tube plant in Italy. The initiative focuses on studying hydrogen supply and adapting the mill for gas use in an electric arc furnace to lower CO2 emissions. It is part of the Dalmine Zero Emissions project, with plans to evaluate further hydrogen applications after initial tests.

title: Hydrogen to decarbonize steel: first trial launched in Italy
summary: Tenaris, Snam, and Tenova launched Italy's first trial using hydrogen at a steel plant to process products at the Dalmine mill in Bergamo. The six-month trial tests a hydrogen-fueled burner in a reheating furnace for hot rolling seamless pipes, aiming to lower CO2 emissions and develop safety guidelines. It supports Tenaris's goal to reduce its carbon footprint by 30% by 2030.

title: Steel and aluminum tariffs, Trump reconsiders: Prysmian sinks, Tenaris rises on the Milan Stock Exchange. What's happening?
summary: Reports indicate U.S. President Trump is reconsidering steel and aluminum tariffs, impacting European stocks. Prysmian shares sank while Tenaris rose on the Milan Stock Exchange amid this development. The article explores the market reactions and underlying events.
